section.title: Description
section.p: Encryption keys must have a retirement, replacement, or destruction process in place. Retired keys are not used for encryption operations. The retirement process will be accomplished through periodic rotation performed by key custodians.

section.title: Implementation
section.p: Keys must be retired in the following situations:

li.p: At the end of its defined cryptoperiod.
If integrity of the key has been weakened.
If suspected of or known to be compromised.
When transitioning to a new algorithm.

section.p: Keys are rotated every 90 days. The following operations are performed at the time of rotation.
